prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system according to the given parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.625, 0.0] Next, create the sketch for Face 1 with the following loop and lines: * Loop 1 + Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] -> [0.75, 0.0] + Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] -> [0.75, 0.125] + Line 3: [0.75, 0.125] -> [0.25, 0.125] + Line 4: [0.25, 0.125] -> [0.25, 0.5] + Line 5: [0.25, 0.5] -> [0.0, 0.5] + Line 6: [0.0, 0.5] -> [0.0, 0.0] Part 2: Create a second part that resembles a thinner version of the first part but shares the same bottom face. Since Part 2 shares the same bottom face as Part 1, you will not need to create a new coordinate system. Create the sketch for Face 2 with the following loop and lines: * Loop 1 + Line 1: [0.25, 0.125] -> [0.75, 0.125] + Line 2: [0.75, 0.125] -> [0.75, 0.5] + Line 3: [0.75, 0.5] -> [0.25, 0.5] + Line 4: [0.25, 0.5] -> [0.25, 0.125] After creating the sketch for Face 2, extrude it by 0.125 units towards the normal using the "JoinFeatureOperation" to add it to the existing model. The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The prism is composed of two rectangular faces, one on top and one on the bottom, connected by a curved edge. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the curved edge forms a smooth transition between the two faces. The model is centered and isolated against a white background. The length and width of each part, as well as the final shape, are as follows: * Part 1: + Length: 0.75 + Width: 0.625 + Height: 0.75 * Part 2: + Length: 0.75 + Width: 0.125 + Height: 0.75 * Final shape: + Length: 0.75 + Width: 0.625 + Height: 0.75</description>
